title: Mastering KDP Niche Research for Publishers | Niche Research Weekly | Session 1

tactics.name: BSR + Review Analysis
tactics.description: Identify trending niches by analyzing bestseller rankings (BSR) and review counts using Publisher Rocket
steps: Browse Amazon KDP bestsellers for trending topics
Filter by categories with low BSR thresholds
Evaluate review counts for content quality signals
source_quotes: we can see inside it here we scroll down they've done a really good description

tactics.name: category_analysis
tactics.description: Evaluate niche competitiveness using BSR and review counts with Publisher Rocket
steps: Search keywords like 'learn how to draw'
Check average sales and review counts
Use KDP Spy to analyze top-ranking books
caveats: High competition in broad categories like 'drawing for kids'
source_quotes: we're looking for something that is probably around about 50 or less if possible

tactics.name: Keyword Filtering
tactics.description: Refine keywords by removing outliers and focusing on niches with manageable competition
steps: Use KD Spy to identify keywords
Analyze remaining books' sales ranks and monthly sales
caveats: Competing with books having 4,000+ reviews is challenging
example_niches: how to draw animals for kids
source_quotes: we want to see if there's any books with 150 reviews or less

tactics.name: Category Analysis
tactics.description: Evaluate Amazon categories for niche opportunities using insights tools
steps: Check selectable categories in Publisher Rocket
Analyze category performance with Insights tool
caveats: Ghost categories may require careful selection
source_quotes: you can have a look at the different selectable categories

heuristics.name: Review Threshold Boost
heuristics.condition: If median reviews < 200 then boost niche potential
source_quotes: we can see inside it here we scroll down they've done a really good description

heuristics.name: review_based_niche_selection
source_quotes: we want to see the uh reviews so we can compete with books maybe with about 150 reviews

heuristics.name: Low Review Targeting
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize this niche
source_quotes: we can compete with books with 150 reviews or less

claims.statement: KDP authors should avoid publishing in niches they research to maintain focus
source_quotes: I'm not going to be publishing more books of my own into these particular niches

claims.statement: KDP prioritizes books with BSR < 50,000 and 150+ reviews for visibility
source_quotes: anything about 150,000 or thereabouts is a good book to pursue

claims.statement: Amazon allows direct category placement for books
source_quotes: you can place your book directly into this categories of placement

niche_patterns.description: Combines target audience identity with specific problems and constraints for niche differentiation
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Creates unique content opportunities with lower competition
source_quotes: there might be a niche that we find today that you'd like to publish in and become an expert in that particular Niche

niche_patterns.description: Break down broad niches into specific age groups and skill levels
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Reduces competition while maintaining market size
source_quotes: learn how to draw for kids 9 to 12
